form.page_subtitle: CWC Diagnostic: Assessment of Child: Main Symptoms: Diarrhoea> Perssitent Diarrhoea

field.name: Child has had Diarrhea for | 14 days or more and currently classified as SEVERE or SOME DEHYDRATION | Skin pinch goes back slowly. etc
Advise the mother on feeding a child who has PERSISTENT DIARRHOEA as below:
If still breastfeeding, give more frequent, longer breastfeeds, day and night.
replace half the milk with thick porridge
For other foods, follow feeding recommendations for the child’s age.
Give one dose daily of Zinc and multivitamins / mineral supplement for 14 days
TELL THE MOTHER HOW MUCH ZINC TO GIVE (20 mg tab) :
2 months up to 6 months —- 1/2 tablet daily for 14 days
6 months or more —- 1 tablet daily for 14 days
Advise mother on when to return for care immediately per table below: WHEN TO RETURN IMMEDIATELY
Observe mother breastfeeding and counsel her on positioning and attachment if necessary.
Counsel mother on feeding a sick child
Advise caregiver to return after 5 days if condition is not improving and document
